title: Derelict apartment building on Sparks Street to be restored
excerpt: A 48-unit apartment building on Sparks Street, which has been vacant and in disrepair, is set for a major revitalization after Terrace council unanimously approved a development permit for the project
content_html: A 48-unit apartment building on Sparks Street, which has been vacant and in disrepair, is set for a major revitalization after Terrace council unanimously approved a development permit for the project at a council meeting Oct. 27. The permit allows the owners of 4204 Sparks Street to proceed with extensive exterior renovations, parking lot improvements, and new landscaping for the three-story building. The project was met with enthusiasm from council, who see it as a critical addition to the city’s strained housing market. “It’s really great to see people willing to put investment into a building that I think a lot of people had assumed was a write-off,” said Councillor James Cordeiro.
